intro: Actinoschoenus yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan actinoschoenus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
